Job__07.1: The life of man upon earth is a warfare, and his days are like the days of a hireling.
Job__07.2: As a servant longeth for the shade, as the hireling looketh for the end of his work;
Job__07.3: So I also have had empty months, and have numbered to myself wearisome nights.
Job__07.4: If I lie down to sleep, I shall say: When shall arise? and again I shall look for the evening, and shall be filled with sorrows even till darkness.
Job__07.5: My flesh is clothed with rottenness and the filth of dust, my skin is withered and drawn together.
Job__07.6: My days have passed more swiftly than the web is cut by the weaver, and are consumed without any hope.
Job__07.7: Remember that my life is but wind, and my eyes shall not return to see good things.
Job__07.8: Nor shall the sight of man behold me: thy eyes are upon me, and I shall be no more.
Job__07.9: As a cloud is consumed, and passeth away: so he that shall go down to hell shall not come up.
Job__07.10: Nor shall he return my more into his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
Job__07.11: Wherefore I will not spare my month, I will speak in the affliction of my spirit: I will talk with the bitterness of my soul.
Job__07.12: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou hast enclosed me in a prison?
Job__07.13: If I say: My bed shall comfort me, and I shall be relieved speaking with myself on my couch:
Job__07.14: Thou wilt frighten me with dreams and terrify me with visions.
Job__07.15: So that my soul rather chooseth hanging, and my bones death.
Job__07.16: I have done with hope, I shall now live no longer: spare me, for my days are nothing.
Job__07.17: What is a man that thou shouldst magnify him? or why dost thou set thy heart upon him?
Job__07.18: Thou visitest him early in the morning, and thou provest him suddenly.
Job__07.19: How long wilt thou not spare me, nor suffer me to swallow down my spittle?
Job__07.20: I have sinned: what shall I do to thee, O keeper of men? why hast thou set me opposite to thee, and I am become burdensome to myself?
Job__07.21: Why dost thou not remove my sin, and why dost thou not take away my iniquity? Behold now I shall sleep in the dust: and if thou seek me in the morning, I shall not be.
